text: The first comment under this song said when John Mayer’s back with long hair you know the album’s going to be epic. In response to this remark. I disagree to an extent. True talent has absolutely nothing to do with a musician’s age, race, sexual orientation, religion, appearance, or anything else! What does matter, and the ONLY thing that does, is that the person has talent - nothing more! No matter what John looks like, he is, and always will be, a great artist imo! I’m 67 years old now and was trained as a classical pianist and organist since I was 5. I learned at a very young age that a person can learn how to read notes and play them, and/or sing them, on an instrument, but that doesn’t mean they can make music ‘come to life’ like Mayer can! This has to come from deep within the person’s heart and soul, and this is what makes him a gifted artist.

text: Nice I guess. I was in high school at the beginning of the 80's but all I hear in this song is Keyboard percussion and guitar solo ripped off straight from TOTO. Being a guitar player and Musician myself I usually hope for some creativity and originality rather than rehashing great work from the past. Toto as a band was a group of  incredible musicians. Plus  I don't know who put him in Johnny Depps costume and hair style from 21 Jump street but there is such a thing as paying ode to something and a bit different just recycling. Look I grew up on the music of the late 70's and early 80's seeing a lot of these bands live like the Police, Clash, Black flag and this list goes on and on but the 80's wasn't just the soft rock of MJ, and many others. There was real new music being pushed forward in the late 70's and early 80's. Nostalgia is one thing but when I can recognize easy the keyboard and percussion multitrack loop that actually was the first of its kind at that point then your ripping off half the song Africa by Toto. John Mayer your a lot more talented than this.
